description: Enterprise techniques used by Tropic Trooper, ATT&CK group G0081 v1.1
name: Tropic Trooper (G0081)

techniques.comment: Tropic Trooper has leveraged the BITSadmin command-line tool to create a job and launch a malicious process.
Tropic Trooper can use ports 443 and 53 for C2 communications via malware called TClient.
Tropic Trooper used shellcode with an XOR algorithm to decrypt a payload.
Tropic Trooper has been known to side-load DLLs using a valid version of Windows Address Book executable with one of their tools.
Tropic Trooper has executed commands through Microsoft security vulnerabilities, including CVE-2017-11882, CVE-2018-0802, and CVE-2012-0158.
Tropic Trooper has created a hidden directory under C:\ProgramData\Apple\Updates\.
Tropic Trooper used pr to scan for open ports on target systems.
Tropic Trooper used netview to scan target systems for shared resources.
Tropic Trooper installs a service pointing to a malicious DLL dropped to disk.
Tropic Trooper has encrypted configuration files.
Tropic Trooper enumerates the running processes on the system.
Tropic Trooper has injected a DLL backdoor into a file dllhost.exe.
Tropic Trooper searches for anti-virus software running on the system.
Tropic Trooper sent spearphishing emails that contained malicious Microsoft Office attachments.
Tropic Trooper uses SSL to connect to C2 servers.
Tropic Trooper has detected a target system’s OS version.
Tropic Trooper used letmein to scan for saved usernames on the target system.
Tropic Trooper delivered malicious documents with the XLSX extension, typically used by OpenXML documents, but the file itself was actually an OLE (XLS) document.
Tropic Trooper creates the Registry key HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\Shell and sets the value to establish persistence.
